title: Dorchester women, 57, killed in Randolph pedestrian crash, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Local News Ruth Samuels, 57, was hit by the vehicle the morning of Oct.
14, the office of Norfolk County District Attorney Michael Morrissey said in a press release.

By Audrey Cooney October 19, 2025 | 7:56 PM Less than a minute to read A Dorchester woman died from her injuries two days after she was struck by a car in Randolph, the local district attorney announced.

title: CBS analyst breaks down why Patriots’ decision to hire Mike Vrabel will be ‘model’ for other franchises
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "We use the word presence a lot with coaches.
Does anyone have more presence than Mike Vrabel?
He’s got it.

title: Drake Maye continues to put himself alongside Tom Brady in Patriots record books
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "I’m trying to be careful with the football and trying to challenge it down the field and not just be a ‘Checkdown Charlie.
’" Drake Maye once again dominated on Sunday against the Titans.

(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Ryan October 19, 2025 | 7:17 PM 3 minutes to read For most Patriots fans entering the 2025 season, a successful sophomore campaign for Drake Maye likely would have involved the 23-year-old taking the sought-after “second-year leap” as one of most promising quarterbacks in the league.

title: ‘We played for Vrabes’: Patriots relished chance to exact revenge for their coach vs. Titans
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “I don’t care what he said.
We wanted to win this for him.
" Mike Vrabel helped deliver a lopsided loss to his former team.

title: ‘Skeletal remains’ of 2 people, suicide note found in Freetown State Forest, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Local News A hunter called 911 to report skeletal remains, according to the district attorney.
A suicide note was also found at the scene, officials said.
The remains of two people were found in the Freetown State Forest, the local district attorney announced on Saturday.

title: Kayshon Boutte said Patriots capitalized on ‘lazy’ defense from Titans
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots “We took advantage of lazy cornerback play, lazy safety play, and [it was] just a big play.
” Kayshon Boutte makes a touchdown catch against the "lazy" Titans defenders in the Patriots' win.
Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff The Patriots’ pass-catchers certainly enjoyed a strong performance in Tennessee on Sunday in the 31-13 win.

title: What Drake Maye said about attending the Catholic Memorial-Xaverian football game
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "I heard it was a big game in the local area.
" Drake Maye attending a high school game between Xaverian Brothers High and Catholic Memorial.
Matthew J Lee/Globe staff The last question of Drake Maye’s Sunday press conference brought a smile to the quarterback’s face.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled in dominant win against Titans
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Drake Maye was precise.
Rhamondre Stevenson set the tone.
K'Lavon Chaisson broke the game wide open.

title: 8 takeaways from Patriots’ blowout win over Titans
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Drake Maye once again dominated on Sunday in Nashville — completing 21 of 23 passes for 222 yards and two touchdowns.
Mike Vrabel and the Patriots left Nashville with a blowout victory.
Andy Lyons/Getty Images By Conor Ryan October 19, 2025 | 12:11 PM 9 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Q&A: Mass. brothers detained from Gaza aid flotilla speak out about prison experience, react to ceasefire deal
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The two brothers, both from Sheffield, were held in an Israeli prison for several days before their release earlier this month.
Adnaan (right) and Torleif (left) Stumo, pictured on a rooftop common area in Southeast Washington, D.
